com.yantra.interop.japi

Interface YIFCustomApi


  • public interface YIFCustomApi
    Implement this interface in any custom API, configured in the service definition framework, to access name/value pairs set in configuration of the custom API.

    Sample CustomAPI
                  
 import java.io.*;
 import java.util.*;
 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
 import com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSEnvironment;
 import com.yantra.interop.japi.YIFCustomApi;
 public class CustomApi implements YIFCustomApi{
    public CustomApi(){}
    private Properties _properties = null;
     //This is a sample customApi, the method doNothing sleeps for a few seconds
     //and returns the input xml document.
    public Document doNothing(YFSEnvironment env, Document doc) throws Exception {
        try{
            double rnd = Math.random();
            System.out.println("CustomAPI Sleeping for " + (long)(rnd*1000) + " milli seconds");
            Thread.sleep((long)(rnd*1000));
        }catch(InterruptedException e){
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        if(_properties != null){
            Enumeration e = _properties.propertyNames();
            while(e.hasMoreElements()){
                String name = (String)e.nextElement();
                System.out.println("Propery Name is: " + name + " Value is: " + _properties.getProperty(name));
            }
        }
        return doc;
    }
    public void setProperties(Properties prop) throws Exception {
        _properties = prop;
    }
 }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setProperties(java.util.Properties prop)
      During configuration of custom API's, Name/Value pairs can be specified, these name/value pairs can be accessed by the custom API as a Properties object by implementing the YIFCustom API interface.

    • Method Detail

      • setProperties

        void setProperties(java.util.Properties prop)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        During configuration of custom API's, Name/Value pairs can be specified, these name/value pairs can be accessed by the custom API as a Properties object by implementing the YIFCustom API interface. In the example above the setProperties method will be called before executing the doNothing method by the framework.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
